title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 96.3 - Minimum size and daily creel limits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 96.3 - Minimum size and daily creel limits

State Regulations

Minimum size and daily creel limits for fishing in the area
shall be as follows: (a) No person
shall take black bass less than 15 inches in length. (b) No person shall take more than three
black bass per day. (c) No person
shall take pickerel less than 18 inches in length. (d) No person shall take more than three
pickerel per day. (e) Yellow perch, carp, sunfish and bullheads may be taken in any size and any number. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
96.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
